title: espresso14
text:
Espresso Lane | News and Notes espresso14 Matt Unrau “MasterChef” contestant Katrina Kozar will host free cooking demonstrations at the Milwaukee Public Market Sunday. 
Do good, have fun: Yelp's Battle at Best Place on Thursday will benefit SHARP Literacy for children, and the Milwaukee Public Market's Harvest Festival on Saturday will mark the market's 10th anniversary while helping Hunger Task Force. 
At 8 p.m. Thursday at Best Place, 901 W. Juneau Ave., nine chefs will create dishes that attendees can taste before voting for their favorites. The event also will have beer, spirits, coffee and sweets samples, alongside entertainment. 
The suggested donation is $20. The event is open to the public with an RSVP by Wednesday on Yelp, at bit.ly/YelpBattle . 
From 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday, the Milwaukee Public Market's Harvest Festival will have food samples, pumpkin lager and apple cider, and activities such as scarecrow building, hay rides, pumpkin bowling and pumpkin carving. Donations of cash and nonperishable foods for Hunger Task Force will be collected. 
On Sunday , guests can see a cooking demonstration by Katrina Kozar of Milwaukee, who was among the top five finalists on Season 6 of Fox network's "MasterChef." 
The free demonstrations will be at noon, 1 p.m. and 2 p.m. at the market, 400 N. Water St. Attendees can register in advance at milwaukee publicmarket.org/10Year.html , but registration isn't required. 
— Carol Deptolla
